item.title: The Last of Us Franchise is Getting a Special Physical Release for PS5 Soon, It‚Äôs Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/the-last-of-us-franchise-is-getting-a-special-physical-release-for-ps5-soon-its-claimed/

According to a reliable source, Naughty Dog plans to release a new special edition for The Last of Us franchise, with a physical PS5 edition in the works. 

A report by billbil-kun on Dealabs states that Naughty Dog is working on ‚Äúa new special edition of a game in The Last of Us franchise‚Äù; however, which game it will be about is unknown. The report also tells us the price, which will be set at EUR 119.99 and USD 109.99, and this mystery edition will be available for purchase in Europe and North America. 

It seems that the mystery special edition of The Last of Us franchise will receive a physical release on the PS5. Moreover, the announcement could arrive very soon, as pre-orders are expected to begin within the next two months. Many players are placing their bets on a bundle that includes the remastered versions of The Last of Us Part 1 and The Last of Us Part 2. 

The Last of Us HBO series will receive a second season on April 13, 2025. The new season will have seven episodes, with one dropping each week. The rumoured pre-order announcement date for this mystery special edition coincides with the end date for season 2 of the HBO series, which could mean something. However, players should take this information with a grain of salt.

In other news, Naughty Dog has been working on an unannounced game for three years, according to a new claim. Also, The Last of Us 2 Remastered is getting free No Return content on the PS5. What are your thoughts on the mystery special edition for The Last of Us franchise? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Black Myth Wukong receiving tons of support from Sony. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Call of Duty Warzone Gets a New Verdansk Gameplay Trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/call-of-duty-warzone-verdansk-trailer/

Call of duty has released a brand-new trailer for Warzone, showing off the return of the original map ‚ÄòVerdansk‚Äô.

The near three-minute trailer shows off the return of the original map, weapons, vehicles and more in spectacular Call of Duty fashion, with the re-confirmation that the map will return with 150 players.

Is this the real life? Is this just fantasy? ü•π No escape from the fight now ‚Äî Drop into the map that started it all in Call of Duty: Warzone on April 3 #VerdanskReturns ü™Ç

According to sources, Verdansk comes at a crucial point for Call of Duty Warzone, with Activision hoping that the map will see a resurgence in players similar to how the original Fortnite map worked for Epic Games.

One source said that Verdansk could be ‚Äúdo or die‚Äù for the free-to-play Battle Royale, whereas another said it likely means Warzone support will dwindle down if its play numbers don‚Äôt increase.

Verdansk is set to return to Warzone not as ‚Äúoriginal‚Äù as some might have expected though. This time, the Battle Royale map will return with some movement adjustments, including keeping in omnimovement. The developers did outline that player movement speed has bee reduced though, to try and stay somewhat in line with how the game originally felt.

Are you looking forward to the return of Verdansk in Call of Duty Warzone? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Monster Hunter Wilds selling 10 million units within a month. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
